question.text: The condition in which there is one to many or one to few chromosomes is called as

solution.text: When chromosome number in an organism increases or decreases in multiple of n than the condition is known as polyploidy, but when one or more chromosome increases or decrease then the condition is known as aneuploidy. For example  <math><mn>2</mn><mi mathvariant="normal">n</mi><mo>+</mo><mi mathvariant="normal"> </mi><mn>1</mn><mo>,</mo><mi mathvariant="normal"> </mi><mn>2</mn><mi mathvariant="normal">n</mi><mi mathvariant="normal"> </mi><mo>–</mo><mi mathvariant="normal"> </mi><mn>1</mn><mo>,</mo><mi mathvariant="normal"> </mi><mn>2</mn><mi mathvariant="normal">n</mi><mi mathvariant="normal"> </mi><mo>+</mo><mi mathvariant="normal"> </mi><mn>2</mn><mo>,</mo><mi mathvariant="normal"> </mi><mn>2</mn><mi mathvariant="normal">n</mi><mo>-</mo><mn>2</mn></math> , etc.
